span.strong: Updated - NYS School Closures, Regents Cancellation and Graduation and Course Requirement Changes

span.p: On Thursday, April 16, Governor Cuomo extended NYS school closures until May 15. The Board of Regents announced that June Regents exams are cancelled. Additional guidance regarding graduation and course requirements was released on Tuesday, April 7.

a.title: Go to comments for Updated - NYS School Regents Cancellation and Graduation Requirements

strong.a: Continuity of Learning Guidelines for Parents

a.title: Go to comments for Continuity of Learning Guidelines for Parents

span.div: Thank you to all who voted! This is a moment in our lives, professional and personal, that will go down in history. Let's share some positivity in these challenging, difficult times. Please use #MillbrookStrong on all communications/social media: in your email signature, on Twitter, Instagram, Facebook, Google Classroom, and have your students/children send pictures/videos with #MillbrookStrong somewhere involved. Or you can send pictures/videos to Caroline Pidala (@jca71127) or Joe Carbone (@mmspecarbone) and they will post for you. Together, we are #MillbrookStrong.

a.title: Go to comments for And the winner is....#Millbrookstrong

strong.a: Healthy Kids Programs Open Emergency Full Day Childcare Programs

a.title: Go to comments for Healthy Kids

p.strong: CHILD CARE COUNCIL OF DUTCHESS and PUTNAM, INC.

span.p: Some professionals integral to the fight against the Coronavirus are eligible for child care for their young dependents. For child care information please complete the initial online survey and a Referral Specialist will contact you.
You can also call a Referral Specialist - 845-473-4141 ext. 222 or 223.

a.title: Go to comments for Child Care for Eligible Professionals

strong.span: Do You Have a Question Related to Millbrook Central School District's Response to the Coronavirus?

a.title: Go to comments for Have a Question Related to Millbrook Central School District's Response to the Coronavirus?

h3.strong: Information Concerning Free & Reduced Price Meals/Información sobre comidas gratis y a precio reducido:

span.p: Breakfast & Lunch will continue to be provided for those who are currently eligible for Free & Reduced Priced Meals while the district is closed. If you feel you qualify for the services please fill out and submit the proper paperwork:

p.a: Free and Reduced Price Lunch Application 2019-2020

span.div: Durante el tiempo que el distrito está cerrado estudiantes que son elegible para comida gratis y reducida vamos a continuar a proporcionar desayuno y almuerzo.
Si cree que califica para estos servicios por favor llena y envía los papeles apropiados.

div.a: 2019-2020 Solicitud de Familia para las Comidas Escolares y Leche Gratis o Precios Reducidos

a.title: Go to comments for Notice Regarding Free and Reduced Price Lunch

span.strong: Notice Regarding Use of MCSD Facilities

p.span: Please be advised that all Millbrook Central School District buildings will not be available for use by outside organizations from 3/13/2020 to 4/30/2020. Our regrets for the inconvenience and gratitude for your cooperation, thank you.

a.title: Go to comments for Notice Concerning MCSD Building Use

span.p: The Millbrook Central School District is exploring Prekindergarten programming. We are seeking community feedback via the survey link below:

a.title: Community Survey - English

p.br: Nos encantaría saber sus opiniones sobre un propuesto programa académico de Pre-Kinder en el distrito de Millbrook!

a.title: Community Survey - Spanish

p.br: For any other questions please contact prekinfo@millbrookcsd.org

a.span: Winter 2019-2020 NYSPHSAA Scholar Athletes and Teams Recognized

div.p: At the end of each sport season, the New York State Public High School Athletic Association (NYSPHSAA) honor teams and individual student-athletes, via the Scholar-Athlete Program, who excel in the classroom and deserve to be recognized for academic excellence.

a.title: Go to comments for Winter 2019-2020 NYSPHSAA Scholar Athletes and Teams Recognized

a.span: Millbrook's Robotics Team Takes First Place Honors

div.p: Millbrook Middle School's City Savers Robotics Team took first place at the Hudson Valley First Lego League Tournament.

a.title: Go to comments for Millbrook's Robotics Team Takes First Place Honors

img.alt: Photo of Mr. Boissey and Mr. Carbone with students

a.span: Vietnam War Veteran Shares His Experiences with Millbrook Middle School Students

div.p: Former Town Board member and School Board member, Mr. Boissey, shared his stories as a Seawolf during the Vietnam War with a group of our students.

a.title: Go to comments for Vietnam War Veteran Shares His Experiences with Millbrook Middle School Students

img.alt: Photos of artwork in Scholastic competition

div.p: Mrs. Jillian Barnes is very happy to share the news that the following students had their artwork selected for the Scholastic Art Awards. This year the Millbrook Central School District had 31 Gold & Silver winners.

a.title: Go to comments for 2020 Scholastic Awards

a.span: Millbrook Students Participate in 2020 Dutchess All-County Junior High Music Festival

div.p: On Saturday, January 25, 2020 the Dutchess County All-County Music Festival was held at John Jay High School in the Wappingers Central School District.

a.title: Go to comments for Millbrook Students Participate in 2020 Dutchess All-County Junior High Music Festival

a.span: Cathie Morton & Students Dedicate MakerSpace to Retiring Superintendent of Schools Philip D'Angelo

div.p: At the December 19th Board of Ed meeting, student representatives from multiple grades assisted Library Media Specialist Cathie Morton in dedicating the Middle School MakerSpace to retiring Superintendent, Phil D’Angelo.

a.title: Go to comments for Cathie Morton & Students Dedicate MakerSpace to Retiring Superintendent of Schools Philip D'Angelo

a.span: VFW Post 9008 Congratulates Patriot Pen Writing Contest Winners

div.p: Fifty-seven Millbrook Middle School students wrote essays for the VFW's 2019 Patriot's Pen Youth Scholarship Competition.

a.title: Go to comments for VFW Post 9008 Congratulates Patriot Pen Writing Contest Winners

a.title: Coronavirus Information

span.h3: Please note that scheduled events have been canceled until further notice. Please refer to the list of Cancellations and Postponements for additional information.

$(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

span.p: The next regular meeting of the Board of Education is Tuesday, April 21, 2020 via Zoom (due to COVID-19) at 7 pm. If the public has questions pertaining to items on the agenda, please email the District Clerk by 5 pm on April 21st @ cheryl.sprague@millbrookcsd.org. All questions will be answered within 48 hours.
